meanings.definition: Burdened with excessive tax or levy.
meanings.sent1: The small business owners felt overtaxed by the new regulations.
meanings.sent2: The citizens were frustrated with being overtaxed by the government.
meanings.sent3: The poor old donkey felt overtaxed carrying all the heavy bags.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like an overtaxed rubber band, ready to snap at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches sagged under the overtaxed weight of the snow.

meanings.definition: Exhausted or strained beyond normal limits.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, my legs felt overtaxed and sore.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's body was overtaxed from the intense training sessions.
meanings.sent3: The overtaxed computer finally crashed after running too many programs.
meanings.sent4: Her overtaxed mind struggled to focus on the complex problem.
meanings.sent5: The overtaxed engine sputtered and stalled on the steep hill.
